DataElement.preferredName: Knowledge Understanding and Judgement Scale Four of Five Patients Who Have Radiation Seeds Have Erections Firm Enough for Sexual Intercourse Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Persons' stated understanding of the statement, four of five patients who get radiation seeds are able to have erections firm enough to have intercourse after radiation, using a true or false indictor.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Knowledge, Understanding and Judgment Scale Four of Five Patients Are Able to Have Erections Firm Enough to Have Sexual Intercourse After Radiation Seeds for Prostate Cancer
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A questionnaire developed to assess a patient's knowledge of prostate cancer, understanding of treatment choices, and judgment of survival with and without treatment._A question about whether an individual thinks that four of five patients who get radiation seeds are able to have erections firm enough to have intercourse after treatment.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A questionnaire developed to assess a patient's knowledge of prostate cancer, understanding of treatment choices, and judgment of survival with and without treatment.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)
